turns.text: What do you think as far as air pollution in the Dallas area
turns.label: qo

turns.text: Well I have some small experience in this area The brown haze that you see if you look down Central towards downtown --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- lot of that is uh tied up with the oxides or nitrogen although some of the kind of bluish gray stuff we see sometimes is tied up with particulates But uh the one of the major problems that Dallas has is oxides and nitrogen Thats because of all the equipment thats being operated But at the same time uh because we dont have we dont burn lot of coal and solid materials we dont get lot of particulates Now particulates would come from trash burning or incineration or something like that here in Dallas
Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: Uh power plants since - many of our local power plants uh are natural gas most of the time uh the things that come off of those plants are carbon dioxide and Theres no particulates in natural gas of course And we pick up little bit of sulphur off some of these products Were burning fuel oil and few other things but gasoline of course now the leads out at least theoretically uh I guess you could say were picking up some sulphur because lot of the fuels does have sulphur Thats why we get that rotten egg smell sometime off the catalytic converter --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Oh really
turns.label: bh

turns.text: -- the sulphur yes And thats uh course hydrogen sulfide which is when you burn gasoline you also produce some water vapor --
Sure
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- and that goes back in with your sulphur and under the right condition you get two But anyway uh -
Well you are you are well versed on the subject I tell you
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Well I dont know

Right

turns.text: And when they run rich they they spit out lot of hydrocarbons and thats another part of the problem The gas is not being burned completely But uh hopefully if we ever get our road system fixed up this will get lot better
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Oh I dont know Ive lived here since seventy-four Howard and I - I think I think they been working on the highways around here since Ive been here and I think I think theyll be working on them long after my wife and I are gone

I understand I sure hope so I tell you You know you get out on the uh interstate highways versus - I travel quite bit and traveling from like Dallas to Austin to San Antonio its the same thing as far as the pollution created by the automobiles in the in the stalled traffic and the busy highways you you youre at your best and I guess when youre out on the interstate heading north or south and youre just cruising right along and theres no build up of cars and -
